properties.address: Thorpe Acre Road, Loughborough, Leicestershire LE11 4LF
properties.description: Warm and welcoming church hall. There is space for children to play and some games are provided. Refreshments are serviced from 10.00am and at 12 noon a simple lunch is served at a cost of just £1.50. This is hot soup and a roll in winter.
properties.title: All Saints Thorpe Acre Church Hall

properties.address: Beveridge Street, Barrow upon Soar, Loughborough, Leicestershire LE12 8PL
properties.description: Tuesday Connect Cafe and afternoon service; Thursday The Harbour - a safe and warm space open to all and includes the food bank; Friday Sports and Crafts - a group for seniors; Sunday morning church service - all welcome
properties.title: Barrow Baptist Church

properties.description: CAN HQ is our hub as an organisation, featuring 3 floors with the ground floor being a community space with rooms for workshops, exhibitions, a shop, and more. On the ground floor, we have our public living room, a space where anyone is welcome to pop in, find out more about what's happening in the local area, and have a chat and free cup of tea or coffee.
properties.title: CAN HQ

properties.description: The foyer of the theatre is open for Community Chat. Everyone is welcome, tea and coffee is available as well as board games, and a friendly group to welcome you with a smile. Dogs are welcome. Money raised from the Community Chat is used to pay for social events for the group, such as theatre tickets or a Christmas dinner.
properties.title: Century Theatre

properties.description: Open every Tuesday from 10am-12pm A warm space with free tea and coffee. A table of bargain household essentials. Camerado's meet to chat. Tuesdays from 2-4pm Caring Cafe warm space with free tea and cake
properties.title: Christ Church Drop- In morning and Caring Cafe afternoon

properties.description: We provide a warm safe space. We offer hot drinks, biscuits/cake, and a lunch.
properties.title: Christchurch Methodist Church

properties.address: St Anne's Lane, Castle Donington, Leicestershire DE74 2JH
properties.description: Open from 04-11-2022.
properties.title: Church of St Edward King & Martyr

properties.description: Nottingham City Libraries are open to all who live, work or study in the city, providing spaces to meet, read, study, relax, learn and explore. Our libraries host a range of regular activities for all ages where people can meet others in their community while learning a skill or chatting about shared interests from knitting to gaming and of course reading.
properties.title: Clifton Library

properties.description: Micro pub on the High Street, offering a safe space to all for a free Hot Drink, Biscuits and Conversation.
properties.title: Dave Noseley

properties.address: Inspire Culture, Learning & Libraries, East Leake, Loughborough, Leicestershire LE12 6JG
properties.description: Discover a welcoming place to read, learn, and enjoy culture at Inspire Libraries. Whether you want to browse and borrow books, use a PC, research family history, or simply relax in our refreshment areas, we have something for everyone. Join our regular events—perfect for meeting new people and trying activities like crafting, colouring, reading groups, and children’s sessions. Drop in to our Places of Welcome group to reconnect with your community. Looking to learn? Our Adult Learning courses offer a friendly environment to gain new skills or explore a hobby just for fun. Experience cultural events close to home, from jazz and author talks to family concerts, theatre, workshops, and more—all in a welcoming space right in your local community.
properties.title: East Leake Library

properties.description: SPACE OPENING ON 15th January 2025** Elephant Rooms has been set up to provide a welcoming, tranquil, non-clinical and calming environment. Our focus is on relaxation and comfort and to provide a safe space. We operate a book library and an honesty kitchen. We have warm, homely and peaceful rooms, with kitchen in which we provide a welcoming, non-judgemental and therapeutic environment. We have a beautiful garden open for people to wander round and connect with nature.
properties.title: Elephant Rooms

properties.address: Erewash Voluntary Action, Long Eaton, Derbyshire NG10 4HD
properties.description: The space is open to all, every Tuesday, either 1pm-4pm or 10am-1pm (please check times with us before arriving) until the end of March. We have a large space where you can come to keep warm and cosy, help yourself to a drink and a slice (or more) of toast, pastries and cake. Some weeks, we'll be providing a themed activity where you can join in, if you wish.
properties.title: Erewash Voluntary Action - Toasty Tuesdays

properties.description: Open to all. Accessible to pushchairs, wheelchairs and small scooters. Runs on Fridays 10.30-15.00 from 14th November 2025 until Easter 2026. Free hot or cold drinks, biscuits and also sandwiches at lunchtime. Games, toys, books and magazines available or just sit and chat. Feel free to bring your own craftwork or knitting. Quiet room for reading. Free internet. On "The Keyworth" bus route. Community bus transport available on request.
properties.title: Friday Warm Welcome Space

properties.description: Open to all. Accessible to pushchairs, wheelchairs and small scooters. Runs on Fridays 10.30-15.00 from 14th November 2025 until Easter 2026. properties.description: Infusion is open as a warm space every Tuesday from 10:30am to 12noon and Wednesday to Friday from 10:30am until 3pm. Free Wi-Fi, Device Charging, People to chat to, stay as long as you want during opening, Pay it forward/suspended coffee scheme, space to work, Food/Drink for sale
properties.title: Infusion Coffee House & Community Space

properties.title: Mountsorrel Baptist Church

properties.description: Mountsorrel Library is a welcoming warm space for everyone, whatever the weather. As well as all our lovely books we have free weekly clubs and activities for all ages, comfortable chairs, a children's area, free computers and wifi and even jigsaws. Our volunteers will welcome you whenever we're open. We also offer a range of hot and cold drinks for £1 / 50p each. Our hot chocolate is especially popular! We are fully wheelchair accessible.
properties.title: Mountsorrel Library

properties.description: A warm welcome and an invitation to sit and connect near the Clock Tower on Memorial Square. Come into our shop and Peter's Place is to your left behind the willow wall - say hello to the person at the welcome desk, look around the Gallery, ask about our activities and share what you care about - or sit quietly in your own space
properties.title: Peters Place at Coalville CAN

properties.title: Renew Wellbeing Cafe Breaston

properties.description: We are a friendly, community-based library ran by volunteers. Hot and cold drinks are available, along with books, newspapers and magazines. Public computers are also available.
properties.title: Rothley Community Library

Dietary requirements catered for. Newspapers, puzzles, table games, children's toys, quiet area

properties.description: Over the colder winter months, we understand that many people face fuel poverty and struggle to afford heating costs. This is why we have funded a number of Warm hubs that can support people during the cost-of-living crisis. Warm hubs provide a safe place which is warm, friendly and welcoming where attendees can partake in social activities surrounded by the company of others whilst receiving support during difficult times. They offer a lifeline for people in social isolation and those suffering with fuel poverty. The BSA Community Centre will open up to the community as a warm space with WiFi and warm food and drinks. Everyone is welcome and the space will be staffed by volunteers to encourage social interaction.
properties.title: Bangladesh Social Association, Community Centre & Warm Hub - Loughbrough
